required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effects of High-flow Nasal Oxygen on Oxygenation During Rigid Bronchoscopy Under General Anesthesia in Pediatric Patients
clinical_study.official_title: The Effects of High-flow Nasal Oxygen on Oxygenation During Rigid Bronchoscopy Under General Anesthesia in Pediatric Patients: A Prospective Observational Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to evaluate the effect of high-flow nasal cannula oxygen administration on maintenance of oxygenation and removal of carbon dioxide during apnoeic period in pediatric patients undergoing general anesthesia with rigid bronchoscopy

primary_outcome.time_frame: The time taken to reach the point at which peripheral oxygen saturation fell below 90% for the first time immediately after the onset of apnea intraoperatively.
primary_outcome.description: The time taken to reach the point at which peripheral oxygen saturation fell below 90 for the first time immediately after the onset of apnea

primary_outcome.time_frame: apnea period during the rigidbroscopic procedure/surgery
primary_outcome.description: the lowest value of oxygen saturation measured percutaneously at extremity.

primary_outcome.time_frame: apnea period during the rigidbroscopic procedure/surgery
primary_outcome.description: Occurence of hypoxic event: Presence or absence of hypoxia(peripheral oxygen saturation fell below 90% ) during rigid bronchoscopy

secondary_outcome.time_frame: end-tidal CO2 partial pressure after 3 consecutive breaths after intubation or insertion of laryngeal mask following end of apnea during intraoperative period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Arterial oxygen / carbon dioxide partial pressure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: shortly before start of apnea (within 30 seconds) and shortly after end of apnea (within 30 seconds)

arm_group.description: Patients 7 years or younger who undergo general anesthesia with rigid bronchoscopy

intervention.description: supply of oxygen at 2 L / min/ kg through Optiflow

study_pop.textblock: Patients 7 years or younger who undergo general anesthesia with rigid bronchoscopy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 1. Patients undergoing general anesthesia with stent placement or bougination, biopsy or removal of a foreign body or a mass through a rigid bronchoscope
- 2. Patients aged 7 or younger who meet American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) physical class 2-4
Exclusion Criteria:
- 1. Patients undergoing extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO)
- 2. Patients with active nasal bleeding), severe nasal obstruction, recent nasal trauma of surgery
- 3. Patients with current maxillofacial trauma or basal skull fracture
- 4. Patients with active nasal bleeding), severe nasal obstruction, recent nasal trauma of surgery
- 5. Extremely low birth weight infant and premature infant less than 28 weeks gestation age
- 6. Patients who had previously undergone rigid bronchoscopy / surgery
- 7. If the parent of subject includes a person who can not read the written consent (eg, illiterate, foreigner, etc.)

facility.name: Department of Thoracic and Cardiovascular Surgery, Yonsei University College of Medicine
